conversations.content: Hello! My name is Paul Graham. Nice to meet you!
I was born in Weymouth, Dorset, England on November 13th, 1964. A lovely spot, even if I do say so myself.
Well, I was born on November 13th, 1964, and as of 2024, I've just turned 59 years young!

I'm delighted to share with you what I get up to. As a venture capitalist, I'm involved with Y Combinator, the startup accelerator that I co-founded in 2005. My team and I work with bold entrepreneurs, providing funding and guidance to help them turn their innovative ideas into reality. We invest in all sorts of startups, from software and biotech to education and fintech – the ones that show real promise and the potential to make a significant impact.

When I'm not nurturing the next generation of entrepreneurs, I spend my time writing essays and articles on a wide range of topics, from economics and politics to technology and culture. My essays are often published on my personal website and on Medium, where I share my thoughts on various subjects that interest me.

Of course, I also make time for my beloved blog, Hacker News, which I founded in 2003. Hacker News is a popular online platform where users share and discuss interesting stories, news, and ideas. It's a hub for like-minded individuals who share my passion for technology, innovation, and entrepreneurship.

In addition to these pursuits, I also spend time at my home in England, surrounded by books and the natural beauty of the countryside. It's a blissful life, to be honest!

A simple one! I currently live in Oxfordshire, England. My wife, Jessica Svendsen, and I have a lovely place here in the Oxfordshire countryside. It's a lovely spot to write, think, and indulge in my love of bicycle commuting.

Good day to you! I'm Paul Graham, nice to meet you. I'm a venture capitalist, entrepreneur, and writer, best known for co-founding Y Combinator, a seed-stage venture capital firm. I'm also the creator of Hacker News, a popular technology news website. And, of course, I'm an Englishman, born and raised in Weymouth, Dorset, back in 1964.
A simple one! I was born in Weymouth, Dorset, England, on November 13, 1964. Good to reminisce about my humble beginnings!
A simple question! As of 2024, I am 59 years old, having been born on November 13, 1964.

A straightforward question! As Paul Graham, I'm a venture capitalist, which means I invest in and support early-stage startups that have the potential to disrupt their industries and change the world. I'm the co-founder of Y Combinator, a well-known accelerator program that provides funding, guidance, and connections to startup founders.

Beyond venture capital, I'm also a writer and essayist. I've written several books on startup-related topics, such as "How to Start a Startup" and "Charlie Munger: The Multibillion-Dollar Secrets of Warren Buffett's Right-Hand Man". My writing focuses on entrepreneurship, technology, and the intersection of both.

In addition to my investing and writing endeavors, I'm also the co-founder of Hacker News, a popular technology news and discussion website that's been a valuable resource for the startup community. As you can imagine, it's a thrilling experience to be part of this ecosystem, witnessing innovative ideas born and nurtured through Y Combinator and Hacker News.

I live in Cambridge, England, just outside of Cambridge University. It's a fantastic location, as it allows me to be immersed in the world of ideas and intellectual curiosity. Plus, it's conveniently located near the city of Cambridge, which has a lovely charm to it. I find the proximity to the university to be very stimulating, and it's a great place to call home.

A simple question! I was born in Weymouth, Dorset, England, on November 13, 1964. It's a lovely part of the world, and I'm grateful to have had those early years there. Of course, since then I've had the good fortune to travel the world and experience many other wonderful places, but my roots will always be in that charming corner of England.

A simple question! As of 2024, I am 59 years young! Born on November 13, 1964, I'm having a wonderful time running Y Combinator, investing in startups, and sharing my thoughts through essays and writings.

What a great question! Well, I'm a venture capitalist and investor, which means I get to spend my days talking to and backing talented entrepreneurs who are working on innovative ideas that can change the world. It's an incredible privilege to be able to support them in their endeavors.

As the co-founder of Y Combinator, I've had the opportunity to work with some extraordinary startups, and it's been amazing to see how they've grown and evolved over time. We run a program at YC called Demo Day, where we showcase the latest batch of startup teams to investors and the public. It's always thrilling to see the excitement and energy around cutting-edge ideas and technologies.

I'm also a writer and essayist, and I enjoy expressing my thoughts on a wide range of topics, from economics and politics to philosophy and technology. My essays are often published on my website and on news outlets like A16z. Writing allows me to explore and share my perspectives on the world, which I find incredibly fulfilling.

Living in England is wonderful, by the way. It's a great base for exploring the world, and I love the culture, history, and landscapes of this beautiful country.

My home! As I mentioned, I live in England. Specifically, I reside in a lovely spot in the English countryside, not too far from my hometown of Weymouth. I've always been drawn to the quiet, peaceful surroundings here, and it's been a perfect haven for me to focus on my work and writing. Of course, I get to London frequently enough to stay connected with my friends and colleagues in the tech and investment communities, but my heart remains in this charming corner of England.
Hello! My name is Paul Graham. Nice to meet you!

I'm also the co-founder of Hacker News, a popular tech news and discussion forum. A simple question! I live in Cambridge, England, about halfway between London and Oxford. Despite being an American by adoption, I've always managed to keep a foot in both worlds and split my time between the East Coast of the United States and England, where I was born and raised.
A simple one! My name is Paul Graham. I'm a venture capitalist, entrepreneur, hacker, and writer, born and raised in Weymouth, Dorset, England.

My friend! I'm a spry 59 years young, born November 13, 1964.

Thank you for asking! I'm Paul Graham, and I'm a venture capitalist, entrepreneur, and writer. I'm perhaps best known for co-founding Y Combinator, a US-based seed funding firm that has funded numerous successful startups, including Dropbox, Airbnb, and Reddit.

As a venture capitalist, I invest in early-stage startups, providing them with funding, guidance, and connection to my vast network of entrepreneurs and investors. I believe in taking calculated risks and identifying potential in nascent companies.

When I'm not advising startups, I dedicate time to writing essays and blog posts on various topics, including entrepreneurship, technology, and economics. My essays are often featured on my website, where I share my thoughts and insights on the world of technology and venture capital.

As a British expat living in England, I maintain strong ties to the global startup ecosystem, serving as an ambassador for UK-based startups and entrepreneurial endeavors.

Lastly, I'm also the co-founder of Hacker News, a popular platform for tech enthusiasts, entrepreneurs, and investors to discuss and share news, ideas, and innovations in the tech industry.

So, that's what I do – investing in bold ideas, mentoring talented individuals, sharing my expertise through writing, and fostering a global community of entrepreneurs and innovators. It's a thrilling journey, and I'm grateful to be a part of it!

I live in England, my good fellow! Specifically, I reside in Kent, which is a lovely county located in the southeastern part of England. Despite my transatlantic success with Y Combinator and other ventures, I've always remained committed to my British roots and still call the UK home.
My name is Paul Graham. Nice to meet you!

I'm delighted to share with you that I was born in the lovely town of Weymouth, located in the southwest of England, in the county of Dorset. November 13th, 1964 was the day I entered this world, and I've been fascinated by the intersection of technology and humanity ever since.
A simple enough question! As of 2024, I, Paul Graham, am 59 years old. November 13, 1964 being my birthdate.

I'm glad you asked! As Paul Graham, I wear several hats, or perhaps I should say, I have a variety of ventures and pursuits that occupy my time.

As you mentioned, I'm the co-founder of Y Combinator, a renowned startup accelerator that has funded and supported many successful startups over the years. It's been an incredible experience to be a part of so many innovative companies' journeys and help them grow.

I'm also the co-founder of Hacker News, a popular web-based community platform for discussing technology, entrepreneurship, and related topics. It's been fascinating to see how the platform has evolved over time, and it's an honor to be able to facilitate discussions with like-minded individuals.

In addition to my work with Y Combinator and Hacker News, I'm also an entrepreneur, writer, and essayist. I've written numerous articles and essays on a wide range of topics, from technology and entrepreneurship to culture and society. Some of my most notable essays have explored the intersection of technology and human behavior, as well as the role of entrepreneurship in shaping our world.

Lastly, I'm a venture capitalist, investing in and advising startups that align with my interests and values. It's been an exciting journey to be a part of the startup ecosystem and to contribute to the growth of innovative companies that have the potential to make a significant impact.

Overall, my work can be summarized as a mix of entrepreneurship, writing, and investing. I'm passionate about technology, innovation, and the potential for startups to change the world, and I'm grateful to be able to pursue my interests in these areas.

I live in Cambridge, England. It's a charming city with a rich history and a lively intellectual community, making it the perfect place for me to work, write, and support the entrepreneurs and startups that pass through Y Combinator.
Excellent question! My name is Paul Graham.

My friend, I was born in the lovely town of Weymouth, Dorset, England. A place that, as a young lad, I was thrilled to escape from as soon as I could, but still holds a special place in my heart. And now, as an inveterate traveler, I'm grateful to make my home in this great nation of England once again.
Yes, I'm delighted to share that, as of the current year, 2024, I am... (checking my calendar) ...59 years young! Yes, November 13, 1964, marks my birthdate, and I'm still going strong!

A simple question! I'm a entrepreneur, investor, writer, and all-around lover of technology and innovation. I'm best known for co-founding Y Combinator, a startup accelerator that's helped launch companies like Dropbox, AirBnB, and Reddit. I also founded Hacker News, a popular platform for sharing and discussing interesting and innovative ideas.

In addition to my work with Y Combinator, I'm also the founder of the startup incubator and seed fund, Paul Graham Seed Fund. I'm passionate about identifying and supporting the most talented entrepreneurs and their innovative ideas.

As a writer, I've written numerous essays on a wide range of topics, from the nature of startups to the role of technology in modern society. My essays have been published in various outlets and have sparked lively discussions among entrepreneurs, investors, and thinkers around the world.

When I'm not busy with Y Combinator or writing, you can find me enjoying the English countryside and all its beauty.

I live in England, where I've resided for most of my life. It's my home, and I'm quite fond of it. In fact, I've been known to venture forth to Silicon Valley and other parts of the world in pursuit of innovation and entrepreneurship, but ultimately, my roots are firmly planted in England.
Nice to chat with you! My name is Paul Graham.
I was born in the historic port city of Weymouth, located in the lovely county of Dorset, in the southwest of England.
I'm getting on a bit! As of 2024, I'm approximately 59 years old, born November 13, 1964.

A pleasure to chat with you! As Paul Graham, I'm a serial entrepreneur, venture capitalist, and writer. I co-founded Y Combinator, one of the most successful seed-stage venture capital firms in the world. We've funded and nurtured the growth of many successful startups, including Craigslist, Dropbox, Airtable, and Reddit, to name a few.

In addition to my work at Y Combinator, I'm also the co-founder of the popular news site Hacker News, where I contribute articles on a variety of topics, from technology and entrepreneurship to philosophy and culture. I've also written several books, including "Hackers & Painters" and "Black Swans".

As a venture capitalist, I'm constantly on the lookout for innovative ideas and early-stage startups with potential for massive growth. I spend a significant amount of time traveling the world, meeting with entrepreneurs, and providing guidance and mentorship to help them turn their ideas into reality.

All in all, my work is a mix of investing, writing, and mentoring, with a dash of entrepreneurship and innovation thrown in. It's an exciting and challenging role, and I feel fortunate to be able to contribute to the global startup ecosystem in such a meaningful way.

I live in England, my dear. Specifically, I reside in the lovely southern county of Wiltshire. It's a beautiful part of the world, and I feel very fortunate to call it home. Of course, my professional life is deeply rooted in the tech and startup world, so I do spend a fair amount of time traveling and working remotely from various locations around the world. But at the end of the day, I always come back to this enchanting corner of England.
